'''Pauline Cushman''' ([[June 10]], [[1833]]–[[December 7]], [[1893]]), a [[New Orleans]]-born [[actress]], served as a Union [[American Civil War spies|spy]] in the [[American Civil War]]. After becoming an actress, she moved from New Orleans to [[New York]] at the age of 18. During the [[American Civil War|Civil War]], she became a [[transvestite]] [[spy]], discovering the battle plans of [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] [[general]] [[Braxton Bragg]]. She was caught and sentenced to death, but escaped [[Execution (legal)|execution]], enabling her to keep providing intelligence information to [[General]] [[William Rosecrans]] and [[President of the United States|President]] [[Abraham Lincoln]]. She was given the honorary commission of Major by President Abraham Lincoln. She toured the country for a number of years, telling of her exploits. She finally settled in Casa Grande, Arizona, with her third husband, sheriff Jere Fryer. After a few years of marriage, she moved to San Francisco where she spent the last years of her life as a scrubwoman. In her later life, she became ill and took opium for her illness. Then She soon became addicted to opium, and took her own life.
+
'''Pauline Cushman''' ([[June 10]], [[1833]]–[[December 7]], [[1893]]), a [[New Orleans]]-born [[actress]], served as a Union [[American Civil War spies|spy]] in the [[American Civil War]]. After becoming an actress, she moved from New Orleans to [[New York]] at the age of 18. During the [[American Civil War|Civil War]], she became a [[transvestite]] [[spy]], discovering the battle plans of [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] [[general]] [[Braxton Bragg]]. She was caught and sentenced to death, but escaped [[Execution (legal)|execution]], enabling her to keep providing intelligence information to [[General]] [[William Rosecrans]] and [[President of the United States|President]] [[Abraham Lincoln]]. She was given the honorary commission of Major by President Abraham Lincoln. She toured the country for a number of years, telling of her exploits. She finally settled in Casa Grande, Arizona, with her third husband, sheriff Jere Fryer. After a few years of marriage, she moved to San Francisco where she spent the last years of her life as a scrubwoman. In her later life, she became ill and took opium for her illness. She soon became addicted to opium, and took her own life.
*[http://www.spartacus.schoolnet.co.uk/USACWcushman.htm Biography from Spartacus Educational]
*[http://www.spartacus.schoolnet.co.uk/USACWcushman.htm Biography from Spartacus Educational]
